docs.title: Disciple of the Martyred Saint
docs.text: You have been imbued with divine abilities to reward your faith in the Martyred Saint—The One Who Endures. These abilities take the form of divine spells. Your path in life is to face danger head-on and defy it. What better way to show your virtue to the Martyred Saint and her teachings than to suffer and spread her miracles?

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
• Base damage: d6
  • Load: 9+STR
  • Maximum HP: 8+Constitution
  • Symbol: Hands clasped in prayer and bound with cord

docs.title: Diety
docs.text:
You serve and worship the Martyred Saint. She speaks to and through you. She represents:

  • Mercy for the oppressed.
  • Wrath against slavery of body, mind, or soul, whether living or dead.
  • The sanctity of suffering and is petitioned by such.

The Martyred Saint has multiple personas manifest in different situations: Battle through her Templars; Judgement through her Monks; Death through her Incarnations; Vengence through her Undying; And Healing, Protection, and Wisdom through you, her Disciple.

She has a favored group, a chosen people, her followers of the Saint.

docs.title: Heritage
docs.text:
• Dwarf: Choose one of the following:

    • When you suffer a debility, you may take an additional d4 damage (ignores armor) and gain +1 forward.
    • You are one with stone. When you commune, you are also granted a particular version of the level five spell Words of the Unspeaking as a rote that works only on stone.

  • Elf: Choose one of the following:

    • You are always graceful, even in suffering. When you take a debility to DEX, you suffer a -1 penalty to another stat of your choice, but never to DEX.
    • You know what patience is. For you, non-violent protest counts as making camp and recovering, even under harsh conditions.

  • Halfling: Choose one of the following:

    • You sing the Healing Songs of Spring and Brook. When you make camp, you and your allies heal +d6.
    • When you take a debility, you gain +DEX armor.

  • Human: Choose one of the following:

    • When you pray for guidance, even for a moment, if you ask, “What here is antithetical to the Martyred Saint?” the GM will tell you, honestly.
    • You can have two debilities affecting your WIS score. Each gives you a -1 penalty, and having both gives you a -2 penalty. This brings your maximum number of debilities up to seven.

docs.title: Example Drives
docs.text:
• Bring the benefits of the Saint to people of a different faith.
  • Defend others who share your faith.
  • Discredit a dangerous misconception about your sphere influence.
  • Disrupt the workings of authorities who do not share your faith.
  • Sacrifice something to your sphere of influence instead of accepting personal gain.

docs.title: Gear
docs.text:
You have clothes appropriate to your calling, dungeon rations (5 uses, 1 weight), and an item that symbolizes your devotion to the Martyred Saint (0 weight, describe it), and choose one:

  • Adventuring gear (5 uses, 1 weight)
  • Bandages (3 uses, slow) and a healing potion
  • Staff (close, two-handed, 1 weight)

docs.title: Starting Moves
docs.text: You gain the following moves at level one.

docs.title: Devotion
docs.text:
You are devoted to the Martyred Saint. She fills your life with purpose, your soul with enthusiasm, and your limbs with strength.

Your Devotion to the Martyred Saint gives you a unique insight and the ability to cast spells in the following spheres of her divine power:

  • Healing
  • Protection
  • Wisdom

Also, as a disciple of the Martyred Saint, you live by a set of codes, strictures, or tenets, things you are supposed to do, and some things you are forbidden to do.

At a minimum, the Saint’s teachings demand the following personal code:

  • Must ease suffering whenever you can.
  • Forbidden from wearing armor.
  • Harming others requires penance: fasting or self-flagellation.

You can also further flesh out your lifestyle during play.

docs.title: Cast a Miraculous Spell
docs.text:
When you unleash a spell granted to you by your devotion, roll+WIS. On a 10+, the spell is successfully cast, and your devotion does not revoke it; you may cast it again. On a 7-9, the spell is cast, but choose one:

  • After you cast it, the spell is revoked. You can only cast the spell again once you Commune and have it granted to you.
  • You draw unwelcome attention or put yourself in a spot. The GM will tell you how.
  • Your casting strains your devotion—take -1 ongoing to cast a spell until the next time you commune.

Note: Maintaining spells with ongoing effects will sometimes cause a penalty to your roll to cast a spell.

docs.title: Commune
docs.text:
When you spend uninterrupted time (an hour or so) in quiet contemplation of your devotion, you:

  • Lose any spells already granted to you.
  • Are granted new spells of your choice whose total levels don’t exceed your level+1, none of which is higher than your level.
  • Prepare all of your rotes, which never count against your limit.

Your spheres of divine insight determine which spells you can cast—you cannot be granted spells from other spheres or classes.

docs.title: Sacrifice
docs.text:
When you touch someone and make a demand of them, if they do what you ask, take an attribute debility of your choice and choose one:

  • They are healed for half your current HP.
  • They are healed of one debility.
  • They are healed of one injury (like a broken arm).
  • They gain d8 temporary HP. Damage reduced the temporary HP first, but it cannot be healed.

You must ask for something immediate, not long-term, and if you already have all six debilities, you cannot heal them.

docs.title: Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken
docs.text: When you prepare yourself to endure some hardship without fighting back, roll+CON. On a hit, you can take half damage or completely ignore another ill effect. On a 10+, you can defeat, expose, or frustrate your oppressor with your stubbornness.

docs.title: Advanced Moves
docs.text: You may pick from the following moves starting at level two.

docs.title: By Nature Sustained
docs.text: You don’t need to eat or drink. If a move tells you to mark off a ration, ignore it.

docs.title: Chosen One
docs.text:
Requires: Cast a Miraculous Spell

Choose one spell. You are granted that spell as if it was one level lower.

docs.title: Devoted Healer
docs.text: When you heal someone else of damage, add your level to the amount of damage healed.

docs.title: Divine Protection
docs.text: When you wear no armor or shield, you have 2 armor.

docs.title: Empower
docs.text:
Requires Cast a Miraculous Spell

When you cast a spell, on a 10+, you can choose from the 7-9 list. If you do, you may choose one of these effects as well:

  • The spell’s effects are doubled.
  • The spell’s targets are doubled.

docs.title: First Aid
docs.text:
Requires Cast a Miraculous Spell

Cure Light Wounds is a rote for you and therefore doesn’t count against your limit of granted spells.

docs.title: Iron Will
docs.text: When you are subject to mind control or magic that influences your feelings, you may choose to take d4 damage (ignores armor) and ignore the influence.

docs.title: Penitent
docs.text: When you take damage and embrace the pain, you may take +d4 damage (ignores armor). If you do, take +1 forward.

docs.title: Serenity
docs.text: You ignore -1 on casting for your first ongoing spell.

docs.title: Stigmata
docs.text: When you display your bleeding, take d4 damage (ignores armor) and choose one person who can see. They heal 2d8 damage. Your wounds leave bloody stains that do not come out until the damage caused by their infliction is healed.

docs.title: Master Moves
docs.text: You may pick from the following moves starting at level six.

docs.title: Anointed
docs.text:
Requires Chosen One

Choose one spell in addition to the one you picked for the chosen one. You are granted that spell as if it was one level lower.

docs.title: Caretaker’s Insight
docs.text:
When you Discern Realities, if you study someone who is afflicted, injured, or in pain, you may ask questions from this list instead:

  • What do you hope for the future?
  • What do you intend to do now?
  • What do you want from me?
  • What makes you feel beautiful or loved?
  • What’s wrong with you, and how could I help you?

When you heal someone, also ask one of these questions.

docs.title: Divine Armor
docs.text:
Replaces Divine Protection

When you wear no armor or shield, you have 3 armor.

docs.title: Greater Empower
docs.text:
Replaces Empower

When you cast a spell, on a 10-11, you can choose from the 7-9 list. If you do, you may choose one of these effects as well. On a 12+, you can choose one of these effects for free.

  • The spell’s effects are doubled.
  • The spell’s targets are doubled.

docs.title: Greater First Aid
docs.text:
Requires First Aid

Cure Moderate Wounds is a rote for you and therefore doesn’t count against your limit of granted spells.

docs.title: Greater Stigmata
docs.text:
Replaces Stigmata

When you display your bleeding, take d4 damage (ignores armor) and choose one person who can see. They heal 2d8 damage and all your other allies who can see you heal d8 damage each. Your wounds leave bloody stains that do not come out until the damage caused by their infliction is healed.

docs.title: Healthy Distrust
docs.text: Whenever the unclean magic wielded by mortals causes you to Defy Danger, treat a miss as a 7-9 instead.

docs.title: Martyr
docs.text:
Replaces Penitent

When you take damage and embrace the pain, you may take +d4 damage (ignoring armor). If you do, gain +1 forward and add your level to any damage done or healed by your following action.

docs.title: Providence
docs.text:
Requires Serenity

You ignore -1 on casting for two ongoing spells.

docs.title: Spells
docs.text: Your faith in the Martyred Saint grants you miracles in three of her divine spheres: healing, protection, and wisdom.

docs.title: Endure
docs.text:
Ongoing

As long as this spell is ongoing, you or an ally you touch can endure extreme heat or cold, like walking across burning sands or swimming through arctic waters. While this spell is ongoing, take a -1 to cast a spell.

docs.title: Guidance
docs.text: The symbol of your deity appears before you and gestures towards the direction or course of action your deity would have you take, then disappears. The message is through gesture only; your communication through this spell is severely limited.

docs.title: Sanctify
docs.text: Your deity consecrates the food or water you hold in your hands while you cast this spell. In addition to being holy or unholy, the affected substance is purified of any mundane spoilage.

docs.title: Cure Light Wounds
docs.text: At your touch, wounds mend, and bones cease to ache. Heal an ally you touch of d8 damage.

docs.title: Detect Alignment
docs.text: When you cast this spell, choose an alignment: Good, Evil, Lawful, or Chaotic. One of your senses is briefly able to detect that alignment. The GM will tell you what there is of that alignment.

docs.title: Invigorate
docs.text: One ally you touch is cured of fainting, lethargy, paralysis, or unconsciousness, and you can instantly move again.

docs.title: Mending
docs.text: Your devotion allows you to fix some mundane object without needing tools or expertise.

docs.title: Planning
docs.text:
Ongoing

Cast this spell when you devise a plan to understand the situation better. When you carry out that plan, gain +1 forward. You can only have a heightened understanding of one plan at a time.

docs.title: Sanctuary
docs.text: As you cast this spell, you walk the perimeter of an area, consecrating it to your deity. As long as you stay within that area, you are alerted whenever someone acts maliciously in the sanctuary (including entering with harmful intent). Anyone who receives healing within a sanctuary heals +d4 HP.

docs.title: Ward of Protection
docs.text: By drawing a simple glyph on one of your possessions, you will always know if and when it is taken from you and generally where it is located if that should happen. You may only have one Ward active at a time.

docs.title: Analgesia
docs.text:
Ongoing

You touch an ally for a second, and they are cured of all fear, nausea, and pain, whether mundane or magical. While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell.

docs.title: Cure Moderate Wounds
docs.text: You staunch bleeding and set bones through magic. Heal an ally you touch of 2d8 damage.

docs.title: Immunity
docs.text:
Ongoing

Name one specific source of harm, such as burning, cutting, lightning, or poisonous gas. While this spell is ongoing, you are immune to harm from that source and take a -1 to cast a spell. You may still be subject to secondary effects—a fire that does not burn you produces smoke that can still choke you, and drowning is uncomfortable.

docs.title: Inquiry
docs.text:
Cast this spell on a person you can see and ask one question about them from the list below:

  • What does this person intend to do?
  • What does this person need or desire?
  • What is false about this person?
  • Who does this person associate with?

Gain +1 forward when you act on the answer.

docs.title: Silence
docs.text:
Ongoing

Name a location you can see. While this spell is ongoing, no sound can be made in that place, and you take a -1 to cast a spell (assuming the Silence does not prevent spell casting outright).

docs.title: Local Customs
docs.text:
Ongoing

The customs of the people you observe are revealed to you. While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell, and you can determine and mimic local customs wherever you are. You can tell if someone’s behavior is routine or unexpected by observers, and you can predict what kind of behavior is expected of you. Still, you do not gain any additional language skills. While this spell is ongoing, take a -1 to cast a spell.

docs.title: Circle of Protection
docs.text:
Ongoing

Draw a circle on the ground around you or someone else. Until that person leaves the circle’s confines, no extra-planar entity can cross or extend its influence beyond it. While this spell is ongoing, take a -1 to cast a spell.

docs.title: Cure Critical Wounds
docs.text: Heal an ally you touch of 3d8 damage.

docs.title: Reverse Poison
docs.text: With a touch, you cure an ally of any ill effects caused by a poisonous substance, short of death itself. Damage inflicted by the poison itself is healed, but the damage caused by other sources enhanced by the poison remains.

docs.title: True Seeing
docs.text:
Ongoing

Your vision is open to the true nature of everything you focus on. You pierce illusions and see things that have been hidden. The GM will describe the area before you ignore any illusions and falsehoods, magical or otherwise. While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell.

docs.title: Words of the Unspeaking
docs.text: With a touch, you speak to the spirits within things. The non-living object you touch answers three questions you pose as best it can.

docs.title: Heal
docs.text: Touch an ally, and you may heal them of damage by as many points equal to your maximum HP.

docs.title: True Discernment
docs.text: When you cast this spell on the evidence left by some creature or event or something removed from far away, you may study it as if you had discerned realities and rolled 10+.

docs.title: Word of Recall
docs.text: Choose a word. After casting this spell, when you speak the chosen word, you and any allies touching you when you first cast the spell are immediately returned to where you cast the spell. You can only maintain a single location; casting Word of Recall again before speaking the word replaces the earlier spell.

docs.title: Divine Presence
docs.text:
Ongoing

Every creature must ask your leave to enter your presence, and you must give permission aloud for them to enter. Any creature without your leave takes an extra d10 damage whenever they take damage in your presence. While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell.

docs.title: Questing
docs.text: Describe an objective, however complicated. The GM will tell you what it would take to accomplish typically. You can choose one of those requirements, and the GM will tell you a more straightforward—and possible—way to achieve it.

docs.title: Repair
docs.text: Choose one event in the target’s past. All effects of that event, including damage, poison, disease, and magical effects, are ended and repaired. HP and diseases are healed, poisons are neutralized, and magical effects are ended.

docs.title: Incarnation of the Martyred Saint
docs.text: You are a living reincarnation of the Martyred Saint—The One Who Endures—continuing her battle against necromancy and foul sorcery.

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
• Base damage: d6
  • Load: 10+STR
  • Maximum HP: 8+Constitution

docs.title: Diety
docs.text:
You serve and worship the Martyred Saint. She speaks to and through you. She represents:

  • Mercy for the oppressed.
  • Wrath against slavery of body, mind, or soul, whether living or dead.
  • The sanctity of suffering and is petitioned by such.

The Martyred Saint has multiple personas manifest in different situations: Battle through her Templars; Healing, Protection, and Wisdom through her Disciples; Judgement through her Monks; Vengence through her Undying; And Death through you, her Incarnation.

She has a favored group, a chosen people, her followers of the Saint.

docs.title: Heritage
docs.text:
• Dwarf: Choose one of the following:

    • When you deal damage to the undead, deal +1d4 damage.
    • When you swear an oath according to the precepts of your faith, take +1 forward to accomplish it. If you fail to do so, or turn away from your oath (to swear another one, for example), take -1 forward.

  • Elf: Choose one of the following:

    • When you Discern Reality, on a hit, your keen senses also tell you if there are any spirits, ghosts, undead, or extra-planar entities here.
    • Gain +1 forward after meditating for a day.

  • Halfling: Choose one of the following:

    • When you Spout Lore concerning the domain of death or necromancy, take +1 forward.
    • You sing the healing songs of spring and brook. When you make camp, you and your allies heal +d6.

  • Human: Choose one of the following:

    • When you touch someone, you can always tell if they are possessed, and if so, by what.
    • When you turn the undead, you may also ask one question about them, as if you had Discerned Reality and rolled a 7-9.

docs.title: Example Drives
docs.text:
• Bring the benefits of your deity to people of a different faith.
  • Endanger yourself to follow the precepts you are devoted to.
  • Punish a necromancer or summoner of spirits for their misdeeds.
  • Free someone from a troublesome spirit.

docs.title: Gear
docs.text:
You have clothes appropriate to your calling and present situation, dungeon rations (5 uses, 1 weight), and an item that symbolizes your devotion (0 weight, describe it). Choose two:

  • Adventuring gear (5 uses, 1 weight).
  • Bag of books (5 uses, 2 weight).
  • Bandages (3 uses, slow) and a healing potion.
  • Chainmail (1 armor, 1 weight).
  • Mace or warhammer (close, 1 weight).
  • Shield (+1 armor, 2 weight).
  • Staff (close, two-handed, 1 weight).

docs.title: Starting Moves
docs.text: You gain the following moves at level one.

docs.title: Circle of Protection
docs.text: When you draw a magical circle on the ground, roll +WIS. On a 10+, it will keep spirits, ghosts, or extra-planar entities in or out until someone else breaks it. On a 7-9, it will keep them in or out momentarily, but only briefly.

docs.title: Divine Guidance
docs.text: When you petition your deity according to the precepts of your Martyred Saint, you are granted some helpful knowledge or boon related to your deity’s domain. The GM will tell you what.

docs.title: Ghost Seer
docs.text: When you invoke your faith by prayer, you can interact with ghostly, insubstantial, or extra-planar entities, including damaging them if your faith opposes them. However, you can’t deal with the entity separately if they possess someone.

docs.title: A Helping Hand
docs.text: When you enter a civilized settlement, you can always find a follower of the Martyred Saint who will take you in as an honored guest.

docs.title: Turn Undead
docs.text:
When you hold your holy symbol aloft and call on your devotion for protection, roll +WIS. On a hit, so long as you continue to pray and brandish your holy symbol, no undead may come within reach of you. On a 10+, you also momentarily daze intelligent undead and cause mindless undead to flee.

Aggression breaks the effects, and they can act as expected. Intelligent undead may still find ways to harry you from afar. They’re clever like that.

docs.title: Advanced Moves
docs.text: You may pick from the following moves starting at level two.

docs.title: Abjuration
docs.text: When you banish a creature from another plane of existence, roll +INT. On a 10+, it may not approach you further; if it lacks an anchor in this world, it must return to whence it came. On a 7-9, it may only approach you further if you allow it to (or let your guard down). On a miss, you cannot banish it.

docs.title: Ashes to Ashes
docs.text:
Requires Turn Undead

The first time you brandish your holy symbol at an undead creature, deal your damage to it (ignores armor).

docs.title: Divine Intervention
docs.text:
Requires Commune or Divine Guidance

When you petition the Martyred Saint, suffer a debility, and you gain one protection. Lose any protection you already held from this move. Spend that protection when you or an ally take damage to call on your deity, who intervenes with an appropriate manifestation and negates the damage.

docs.title: Ghost Killer
docs.text: When you attack a spirit, ghost, or extra-planar entity, your damage die is a d10.

docs.title: Ghost Talker
docs.text: You can see and interact with all ghosts and spirits of the dead and peer into the spiritual workings of the undead, even if they are mindless. When studying an undead creature, ask whatever questions you like from the Discern Reality list.

docs.title: Heaven’s Weaving
docs.text: When you Parley* with a character, your faith grants you insight into them. Ask their player two questions from the *Discern Reality list.

docs.title: Orison for Guidance
docs.text:
Requires Personal Deity

When you sacrifice something of value to your deity and pray for guidance, your deity tells you what it would have you do. If you do it, mark XP.

docs.title: Spiritual Connection
docs.text: If you have an item from someone that they highly value, you can interact with them as if they were a spirit, ghost, or extra-planar entity and use moves against them.

docs.title: The Scales of Life and Death
docs.text: When someone takes their last breath in your presence, they take +1 to their roll.

docs.title: To Know the Unknowable
docs.text: When you encounter a creature, manifestation, or power from another plane of existence, you can ask the GM from whence it came and what its properties are. Take +1 forward when acting on the answers.

docs.title: Master Moves
docs.text: You may pick from the following moves starting at level six.

docs.title: Armor of Faith
docs.text:
Requires Turn Undead

While turning undead, you and nearby allies are protected, gaining +2 armor. This bonus lasts only as long as there are undead present.

docs.title: Ars Goetia
docs.text: When you first encounter an extra-planar entity, you may ask the GM any one question. The GM will answer truthfully.

docs.title: Funeral Rites
docs.text: When you take time after a battle to dedicate your victory to the Martyred Saint’s ideals and bury the dead, take +1 forward.

docs.title: Cheat Death Again
docs.text:
When you have zero HP, rather than taking your last breath, roll +WIS. On a 10+, you live and choose one:

  • You discover one of Death’s dark secrets.
  • You have a moment with a soul that has already passed on.
  • You manage to avoid Death’s notice.

On a 7-9, you live, but Death takes notice, and you discover something terrible. On a miss, you can cheat death no longer, and you must pass through the Black Gate.

docs.title: Closing the Gateway
docs.text:
When you attack a spirit, ghost, or extra-planar entity, you deal +d6 damage, and your foe can choose to return from whence it came instead of taking damage.

When you reduce a spirit, ghost, or extra-planar creature to zero HP, its soul is subsequently barred from appearing on the material plane in any form. It can still be encountered in astral visions and other planes, but not in your world.

docs.title: Command of Injunction
docs.text:
When you command someone in your presence to cease a specific activity, roll +WIS. On a 10+, they must comply to the best of their ability. On a 7-9, they must comply until you leave their presence.

Only one injunction you issue can stand at any time. Only activities consciously undertaken can be subject to injunction.

docs.title: Divine Invincibility
docs.text:
Replaces Divine Intervention

When you petition your deity, suffer a debility, and you gain 2 protection. Lose any protection you already held. Spend one protection when you or an ally takes damage to call on your deity, who intervenes with an appropriate manifestation and negates the damage.

docs.title: Dust to Dust
docs.text:
Requires Ashes to Ashes

When you reduce a creature to zero HP, its soul is put to rest and cannot be raised again as an undead creature.

docs.title: Evidence of Faith
docs.text: When you see divine magic as it happens, you can ask the GM which deity granted the spell and its effects. Take +1 forward when acting on the answers.

docs.title: Monk of the Martyred Saint
docs.text: You are a fighter, but you fight with honor. For the followers of the Martyred Saint, you embody lawful Judgement. This is what you live and breathe as you wander, righting wrongs. In this domain, you work miracles.

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
• Base damage: d6
  • Load: 9+STR
  • Maximum HP: 8+Constitution

docs.title: Diety
docs.text:
You serve and worship the Martyred Saint. She speaks to and through you. She represents:

  • Mercy for the oppressed.
  • Wrath against slavery of body, mind, or soul, whether living or dead.
  • The sanctity of suffering and is petitioned by such.

The Martyred Saint has multiple personas manifest in different situations: Battle through her Templars; Healing, Protection, and Wisdom through her Disciples; Death through her Incarnations; Vengence through her Undying; And Judgement through you, her Monk.

She has a favored group, a chosen people, her followers of the Saint.

docs.title: Heritage
docs.text:
• Dwarf: As long as you have Chi left, you cannot be pushed, thrown, tripped, or knocked over.
  • Elf: As long as you have Chi left, you may defend with DEX instead of CON and hack and slash with DEX instead of STR.
  • Halfling: When you fight with honor, add this to the list of deeds you can spend a Chi to perform—Dodge a blow meant for you.
  • Human: When you arrive at a new settlement, followers of the Martyred Saint will accept you as their guest and provide you with friendship, hospitality, and advice. If you also agree to help them solve a problem they have, gain +1 forward.

docs.title: Example Drives
docs.text:
• Advance the interests of the Martyred Saint.
  • Bring a villain to justice.
  • Choose honor over personal gain.
  • Fulfill a promise to protect someone during a dangerous journey or situation.
  • Ignore danger to aid another.

docs.title: Gear
docs.text:
You have a token of membership in your honorable fighting society, such as a robe, sash, or scroll. Describe it.

You have clothes appropriate to your calling and present situation, dungeon rations (5 uses, 1 weight), and choose one:

  • Adventuring gear (5 uses, 1 weight)
  • Bandages (3 uses, slow) and a healing potion

docs.title: Starting Moves
docs.text: You gain these starting moves at level one.

docs.title: Sphere of Influence
docs.text: Your faith and discipline to the teachings of the Martyred Saint allow you to cast any spell from her divine sphere of Judgment that does not exceed your level.

docs.title: Cast a Holy Spell
docs.text:
When you cast a spell from your sphere of influence, roll +WIS. On a 10+, you cast the spell but choose one consequence from the list below.

  • The spell’s effect is doubled, but you may not cast this spell again until after you sleep for a night.
  • The spell’s targets are doubled, but you may not cast this spell again until after a night’s sleep.
  • The spell has its typical results.

On a 7-9, you cast the spell, but choose one:

  • You may only cast this spell again after you sleep for a night.
  • Your spellcasting is obvious, and you draw attention to yourself.

docs.title: Fight with Honour
docs.text:
When you enter a fight, roll +CON. On a 10+, hold 3 Chi. On a 7-9, hold 2 Chi. On a miss, hold 1 Chi anyway, but your enemies already have the drop on you.

Spend a Chi during the fight to achieve one of the following effects:

  • Block a blow meant for you or someone else (you take half damage).
  • Break free from bonds or other confinement.
  • Cross the distance between yourself and a foe, bypassing all obstacles.
  • Deal your damage to a foe within reach.
  • Leap over or across a physical obstacle.

You lose any remaining Chi once the fight is over.

docs.title: Fists of Fury
docs.text: You are never unarmed—your body and limbs are a weapon, just as good as any other.

docs.title: Advanced Moves
docs.text: You may choose from these advanced moves starting at level two.

docs.title: Arrows in Hand
docs.text:
Requires Fists of Fury

When you block or dodge a missile attack, roll+DEX. On a 10+, you snatch the missile out of the air, and it deals no damage. On a 7-9, choose one:

  • You avoid the attack completely.
  • You snatch the missile out of the air and take half the damage.

docs.title: Fuelled by Honour
docs.text:
Requires Fight with Honour

If you accomplish your drive during a fight, gain one Chi, up to a maximum of three.

docs.title: Hand of the Monkey
docs.text:
Requires Fists of Fury

If you are unarmoured and carry no shield, you have 2 armor against hand-held weapons. If this reduces the damage you take to zero, you may also disarm your foe.

docs.title: Honourable Society
docs.text: You are a respected member of an honorable fighting society. When you send word to them for aid, you may recruit as if you have a good reputation and are paying generously, even though you are not paying at all. Any hirelings they send to you have at least loyalty +1 and warrior +1.

docs.title: Light as a Feather
docs.text: When you run across a surface that cannot hold your weight, roll +DEX. On a 10+, you do it gracefully and without trouble. On a 7-9, you make it across, but with consequences. The GM will tell you what.

docs.title: Master Moves
docs.text: You may choose from these master moves starting at level six.

docs.title: Glorious Honour
docs.text:
Requires Fight with Honour

When you fight with honor, hold an extra Chi, even on a miss.

docs.title: Hands of the Monkey King
docs.text:
Replaces Hand of the Monkey

If you are unarmoured and carry no shield, you have 4 armor against hand-held weapons. If this reduces the damage you take to zero, you may also disarm your foe.

docs.title: Superior Technique
docs.text:
Requires Fight with Honour

Add these to the list of deeds you can spend a chi to perform:

  • Break through a physical obstacle.
  • Deal your damage to a foe within sight.
  • Grab an item within reach. Now it is yours.

docs.title: Exacting Discipline
docs.text: When you cast a spell, on 12+, you can double the spell’s effect or the number of targets without losing the spell.

docs.title: Contract
docs.text: When you sign a contract that you have cast this spell upon, you are mystically notified if the other party breaks it.

docs.title: Casting Stones
docs.text:
Ongoing

As long as you concentrate on Judgment, any stone you pick up becomes a powerful weapon (thrown, near, 1 piercing). While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell.

docs.title: Cause Fear
docs.text:
Ongoing

Choose a target you can see and a nearby object. The target is afraid of the object so long as you maintain the spell. The target’s reaction is up to the GM: flee, panic, beg, fight. While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell. You cannot target entities with less than animal intelligence (magical constructs, undead, automatons, and the like).

docs.title: Dispel Magic
docs.text: Choose a spell or magic effect in your presence; this spell rips it apart. Lesser spells are ended, and powerful magic is reduced or dampened as long as you are nearby.

docs.title: Hold Person
docs.text:
Ongoing

Choose a person you can see. They can only act if you cast a spell or leave their presence. This effect ends immediately if the target takes damage from any source.

docs.title: Contagion
docs.text:
Ongoing

Choose a creature you can see. Until you end this spell, the target suffers from a disease of your choice. While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell.

docs.title: Harm
docs.text: Touch an enemy and strike them with divine wrath—deal 2d8 damage and d6 damage to yourself. This damage ignores armor.

docs.title: False World
docs.text:
Ongoing

With a touch, you can put someone’s body into an enchanted sleep and their mind into a false world that they believe is real. Until the spell is ended, they continue to live in a world of your creation, not knowing it is a lie and that their body lies sleeping somewhere else.

docs.title: Plague
docs.text:
Ongoing

Name a city, town, encampment, or other place people live. As long as this spell is active, that place is beset by a plague appropriate to your deity’s domains (locusts, death of the firstborn, etc.). While this spell is ongoing, you take a -1 to cast a spell.

docs.title: Templar of the Martyred Saint
docs.text:
Your Martyred Saint called on you for a reason. You hear her voice in your dreams and see her in the eyes of the faithless. You sense her guiding hand when your enemies loom.

They brand you with false names: fiend, inquisitor, zealot. These insults are not who you are. You are a Templar of the Martyred Saint.

Your will is iron, your cause just, and your foes doomed.

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
• Base Damage: d8
  • Load: 10+STR
  • Maximum HP: 10+Constitution

docs.title: Diety
docs.text:
You serve and worship the Martyred Saint. She speaks to and through you. She represents:

  • Mercy for the oppressed.
  • Wrath against slavery of body, mind, or soul, whether living or dead.
  • The sanctity of suffering and is petitioned by such.

The Martyred Saint has multiple personas manifest in different situations: Healing, Protection, and Wisdom through her Disciples; Judgement through her Monks; Death through her Incarnations. Vengence through her Undying; And Battle through you, her Templar.

She has a favored group, a chosen people, her followers of the Saint.

docs.title: Heritage
docs.text:
• Dwarf: Choose one of the following:

    • When you roll for I Am the Law, on a hit, you also gain +d4 damage forward against those you are ordering around.
    • When you take the damage meant for someone else, you gain +1 armor.

  • Elf: Choose one of the following:

    • Choose one weapon—you can always treat weapons of that type as if they had the precise tag.
    • When you Discern Reality while protecting someone, you can also ask, “How can I get my ward out of here?”

  • Halfling: Choose one of the following:

    • When you attack with a ranged weapon, deal +2 damage.
    • When you Defy Danger and use your small size to your advantage, gain +1.

  • Human: Choose one of the following:

    • When you pray for guidance, even for a moment, and ask, “What here is antithetical to the Martyred Saint?” the GM will tell you.
    • When your flock or hirelings helps you fight, you deal +d4 damage.

docs.title: Example Drives
docs.text:
• Deny mercy to a criminal or unbeliever.
  • Endanger yourself to combat an unnatural threat.
  • Endanger yourself to protect someone weaker than you.

docs.title: Gear
docs.text:
You start with all the following:

  • A symbol of the Martyred Saint (0 weight, describe it)
  • Dungeon Rations (5 uses, 1 weight)
  • Adventuring Gear (5 uses, 1 weight)
  • A longsword, axe, or mace (close, 1 weight)
  • A tabard (+1 armor, 1 weight)

You also start with one of the following:

  • A greatsword, maul, or executioner’s axe (reach, +1 damage, two-handed, 2 weight)
  • A crossbow (near, far, 2 weight)

Finally, choose one:

  • Armoured Breastplate (+1 armor, clumsy, 1 weight)
  • Poultices and herbs (2 uses, slow, 1 weight) and antitoxin

docs.title: Starting Moves
docs.text: You gain the following moves at level one.

docs.title: Ardent Squire
docs.text:
You have an apprentice. Name and describe them. Your Squire’s skill for all their abilities equals a third of your level (rounding up.) They start with the following abilities:

  • Intervene: When your Squire defies danger alongside you, you may roll +skill instead. If you do, the Squire takes the brunt of any consequences.
  • Ministry: When you camp with your Squire, if you would heal, you also recover +skill HP.

During a session, the GM may ask what lessons you’ve taught your Squire about the faith. If you answer, mark XP.

docs.title: Divine Sphere of Battle
docs.text:
At the start of a session or when you eliminate a powerful enemy of the Martyred Saint, choose one of the following battle miracles of the Martyred Saint:

  • Bless
  • Magic Weapon
  • Wisdom of War

When you unleash the power of this miracle, roll +WIS. On a hit, the spell is cast. On a 10+, the spell’s power is retained, and you may cast it again.

docs.title: Advanced Moves
docs.text: You may pick from the following moves starting at level two.

docs.title: Behold the Word
docs.text: When you unleash your Blessings of Faith in battle, you gain +1 to the roll.

docs.title: Bound by Faith
docs.text: When you and your Squire deal damage together, add 2x skill to the damage. If there are consequences to your actions, you and the Squire share them.

docs.title: Charge!
docs.text: When you lead the charge into combat, those you lead gain +1 forward.

docs.title: I Am the Law
docs.text:
When you give an NPC an order based on your divine authority, roll +CHA. On a 7+, they choose one:

  • Do what you say
  • Back away cautiously, then flee
  • Attack you

On a 10+, you also gain +1 forward against them. They do as they please on a miss, and you suffer -1 forward against them.

docs.title: Lead the Flock
docs.text:
When you command a group of willing NPCs to do something, they do it, but the GM picks one or more from the following:

  • It’ll take days/weeks/months to complete
  • The flock will question their faith, or yours
  • Doing so will leave ______ vulnerable
  • It will cost you _____
  • First, you must _____
  • You’ll need help from _____
  • You must defeat _____ first
  • The best they can manage is a lesser version

docs.title: Warden of the Innocent
docs.text: When you defend the unarmed or defenseless, gain a +1 hold, even on a miss.

docs.title: Master Moves
docs.text: You may pick from the following moves starting at level six.

docs.title: Crusader
docs.text:
Requires Lead the Flock

When you Lead the Flock in a battle against enemies of the Martyred Saint, they will always give their all for the cause. The GM may not choose “The flock will question their faith” or “the best they can manage is a lesser version.”

docs.title: Ever Onward
docs.text:
Replaces Charge!

When you lead the charge into combat, those you lead gain +1 forward and +2 armor forward.

docs.title: High Warden
docs.text:
Replaces Warden of the Innocent

When you defend, you always gain a +1 hold, even on a miss. When you get a 12+ to defend, the nearest creature is distracted or momentarily stunned, granting you a clear opportunity.

docs.title: Divine Authority
docs.text:
Replaces Voice of Authority

Gain +1 ongoing when ordering hirelings. When you roll a 12+, the hireling transcends their moment of fear and doubt and carries out your order with particular effectiveness or efficiency.

docs.title: Greater Sphere of Battle
docs.text:
Add the following miracles to your available options when preparing your Divine Sphere of Battle. You may also prepare two miracles at the beginning of a session rather than one.

  • Fireball
  • Immunity

docs.title: Bless
docs.text:
Ongoing

The Martyred Saint smiles on you or an ally of your choice. Gain +1 ongoing so long as the battle and spell continue. While this spell is ongoing, you take -1 to cast another spell.

docs.title: Fireball
docs.text: You evoke a mighty flame that envelops your target and everyone nearby, inflicting 2d6 damage that ignores armor.

docs.title: Immunity
docs.text:
Ongoing

Name one specific source of harm, such as burning, cutting, lightning, or poisonous gas. While this spell is ongoing, you are immune to harm from that source and take -1 to cast another spell. You may still be subject to secondary effects—a fire that does not burn you produces smoke that can still choke you, and drowning is dreadfully uncomfortable.

docs.title: Magic Weapon
docs.text:
Ongoing

The weapon you hold while casting does +d4 damage until you dismiss this spell. While this spell is ongoing, you take -1 to cast another spell.

docs.title: Wisdom of War
docs.text: When cast during a battle or on the spot of a historical battle, the GM will tell you something interesting and helpful about that battle, as if you were Spouting Lore and rolled a 10+.

docs.title: Undying of the Martyred Saint
docs.text: As a chosen one, blessed by the Martyred Saint, when you die violently at the hands of Saint’s enemies, you erupt from your shallow grave at sunrise and grasp vengeance. You are now a revenant.

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
Upon your resurrection, you lose your former identity but gain supernatural endurance.

  • Lose one level.
  • Erase your character’s name, bonds, and drives (or alignment).
  • Lose all your former class and heritage moves. You gain new revenant moves described in the following sections.
  • Add 10 to your maximum HP.
  • Take the first Degradation (see the following section).

docs.title: Drive
docs.text: It is now only one burning desire: Revenge!

docs.title: Undying
docs.text:
Your mortal shell has only a tenuous link to your soul.

  • You do not breathe, eat, drink, or sleep.
  • You also do not heal as usual. You gain no benefit from poultices and herbs, bandages, magical healing, make camp, or recovery.
  • You are immune to all effects that turn or control undead.

docs.title: Degradation
docs.text: When you become a revenant, take the first of the following six degradations. Add the subsequent degradation whenever the result of a move instructs you to do so.

docs.title: 1. Strange Appetite
docs.text:
Choose one particular type of sustenance:

  • Bone and marrow
  • Brains
  • Hearts
  • Still-warm blood

You heal a quarter of your HP or remove one debility whenever you eat the sustenance. Your strange appetite is the only way to restore your HP or remove debilities.

Whenever you have the opportunity to indulge your strange appetite, you lose all control and immediately begin to gorge, oblivious to your surroundings, unless you succeed in a Defy Danger roll +WIS.

docs.title: 2. Carrion Stench
docs.text: A horrible odor always follows you. Natural beasts shy away from you or become aggressive.

docs.title: 3. Dark Vision
docs.text: You can see even in absolute darkness. Sunlight pains you. You take -1 ongoing in sunlight.

docs.title: 4. Deathly Visage
docs.text: It’s clear to all who look at you that you are dead. When you use intimidation and your sinister appearance to Parley, you gain +1 forward.

docs.title: 5. Home to Vermin
docs.text: Insects have taken up residence in your corpse. These bugs will do favors if you ask. Treat them as Followers (Quality +0, Loyalty +0, 1 HP, meek, stealthy, swarm, tiny).

docs.title: 6. The Final Degradation
docs.text: Your soul’s tenuous connection to humanity is severed for eternity. Your body spontaneously turns into ash and blows away on an unfelt breeze. Roll a new character.

docs.title: Starting Moves
docs.text: Upon becoming a revenant, you gain the following moves.

docs.title: Forgotten Former Life
docs.text:
Your overriding drive is now simply Revenge and Retribution—nothing else. You have no bonds (or flags or keys).

Add this question to your Discern Realities list:

  • What is the quickest way to my revenge and retribution?

When you act on the answer, gain +1 forward and mark XP.

docs.title: From the Underworld Returned
docs.text:
You bear a mark of your time in the underworld. Choose a part of your body that takes on the visible aspects of death while remaining fully functional:

  • Arm: Any weapon you grasp flows into the underworld. It gains +2 piercing against living creatures.
  • Eye: When you touch a corpse, you see what it saw in its last moments. The GM will describe it.
  • Legs: Your passing leaves no mark or scent as a living person would.

docs.title: Inexorable
docs.text:
When you push the limits of your unliving body, choose one of the following outcomes to attempt.

  • Perform a feat of inhuman strength.
  • Move with uncanny speed and grace.
  • Refuse to be moved, restrained, or knocked off your feet.

Roll +CON:

  • On a 10+, suffer d4 damage (no armor reduction), and the attempt succeeds.
  • On 7–9, suffer d6 damage (no armor reduction), and the attempt succeeds.
  • On a miss, suffer d8 damage (no armor reduction), the attempt fails, and you suffer any other consequences of your missed roll.

docs.title: Sustained by Rage
docs.text:
Neither poison nor disease harms you. You feel no pain. When you take damage from weapons, take half damage (rounded up, after armor reduction).

When you are reduced to zero HP, roll +CON.

  • On a 10+, regain half your HP and choose one effect from the following list.
  • On a 7–9, regain a quarter of your HP and choose two effects.
  • On a miss, regain 1 HP, and all three effects apply.

Effects

  • Add the next Degradation (see the previous section).
  • You’re out of the action and incapacitated for d6 hours or until sunrise (whichever is shorter).
  • Your body is permanently disfigured in some way. Describe it.

Note: If your body is destroyed (for example, burned to ash), treat it as a roll of 6- and your soul lingers incapacitated until your mortal shell reforms with 1 HP at the next sunrise.

docs.title: Undead Aura
docs.text: Dead spirits see your mark and know you as their own. Any dead spirit still clinging to the mortal plane can speak with you. The living, especially the devout, see your mark as a sign of sin. You take a -1 ongoing to CHA rolls with the living who see your mark.

docs.title: Advanced Moves
docs.text: You may pick from the following moves starting at level two. Once both are selected, you gain no new moves when leveling up until level six.

docs.title: Branded
docs.text:
Requires From the Underworld Returned

Choose a second body part to take on the visible aspects of death.

docs.title: Indelible
docs.text:
Requires From the Underworld Returned

The underworld’s mark grows so that it may not be concealed. Describe it. The dead will seek you out, giving you what aid they can and not harm you. The devout will treat you as a heretic.

docs.title: Master Moves
docs.text: You may pick from the following moves starting at level six. Once both are selected, you gain no new moves when leveling up.

docs.title: Blemished
docs.text:
Requires Branded

Choose a third body part to take on the visible aspects of death.

docs.title: Whispers in the Dark
docs.text: When you speak to a dead spirit, you take +1 forward with all who knew that spirit in life.
